item.title: CFF - C Fast Fetch - Developed with l0py2
item.description: What is CFF? CFF consists in a system fetch written for GNU/Linux system. It uses the Kernel api to fetch info such as the uptime and the kernel release name. Why CFF? CFF is essencially a project developed for fun. However, it is the fastest fetching program due to being written in C. Compared to pfetch or even neofetch we get much lower execution times. Usually around 2 milliseconds.

item.title: Qtile
item.description: Qtile running on my machine: Using exa to list the files and cff to fetch sys info. Config file tree: . ├── autostart.sh -- script called with the startup_once hook ├── bar1.py -- bar configuration ├── config.py -- layouts and startup ├── consts.py -- constants ├── gruvbox.py -- colorscheme ├── keys.py -- keybindings └── workspaces.py -- groups autostart.sh: The autostart calls 4 commands and it is called in config.py:
